Reviews.Title: “Decent location, that's about it”
Reviews.Author: starry
Reviews.Content: location is great, close to everything, no need for a car! The staff is friendly enough.The down: its terribly loud and obnoxious, I HATE IT. Drunk people banging on doors int he middle of the night, music blasting, cigarettes in the elevator, People, partying on their balconies!!!! cold water in the morning. I would NEVER recommend staying here, as I am here right now. If I hadn't booked on Expedia I would be outta here!

Reviews.Title: “Great for what you pay!”
Reviews.Author: Scrufflepuff
Reviews.Content: Some girlfriends and I decided to meet up in Montreal for Nuit Blanche this year, we did some price shopping and this hotel gave us an amazing deal! My friend booked the hotel and I was a little nervous after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, but after my stay I was pleasantly surprised! Don't get me wrong you get what you pay for, but the room was clean, the staff were very accommodating and friendly (I arrived at the hotel a few hours before my girlfriend who made the reservation and they allowed me to check in without her). This hotel could definitely use some upgrades. Our balcony door wouldn't shut, balcony was a little questionable, and the elevators are pretty grubby, and if your over the age of 30 I'd suggest staying somewhere a little quieter, but you won't find anything better for your money. It is also right downtown, in walking distance to lots of great pubs and TONS of great shopping. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for the 14th floor”
Reviews.Author: Nouish
Reviews.Content: I've been there twice and I will go back. It's not very expensive and you're in the middle of Downtown Montreal, walking distance to the Bell Centre and shopping on Ste-Catherine's Street. And if you want to go out to a bar, the only problem is trying to pick one, there are so many in the immediate surroundings. The rooms are clean and modern. They're original and somewhat fancy. Good Fen-Shui, I told my hubby. We picked one, twice, with a King size bed. There was a sofa, flat screen TV, fridge and coffeemaker. We asked the maid for packages of real coffee, not the non-decafinated kind, and she was gracious enough to give us what we asked for, plus real cups of milk instead of coffeemate. Local phone calls are free and internet also even though there is a weird kind of timer that starts when you use it. We choose the 14th floor because of the view of beautiful Downtown Montreal since there are balconies for every room. The last time we went there, we were facing Crescent Street, and we were happy to be on the 14th floor because the sounds coming from the people below on the street after last call must have been really bothersome for someone staying on lower floors. We were lucky that no one on our floor partied past 11 pm. But we could hear, on the balconies lower, that some people were there to party all night. Glad they weren't on our floor. The only thing I did not like was, when we were leaving, there was blood on the elevator door. When I told the reception, she told me that someone had cut themselves as if I was curious to find out what had happened. I just wanted them to clean it up before other guests saw that. Pretty gross! But except for that last bit, I really like the place, and cheap for Downtown Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “We got robbed”
Reviews.Author: Annoj S
Reviews.Content: So to start things off, right when we checked into the hotel. the staff did not sound too welcoming as we checked in at 1am and our check in was supposed to be at 3pm. I have no clue why it matters when we check in as we had already paid but nonetheless that was nothing compared to what was to come. The rooms were clean and had a 32 inch flat screen LG tv. The remote however did not work and when we told front desk about the problem they claimed they had no batteries. We just stayed the first night inside our hotel drinking a couple of beers. The next night everything was fine. We had no issue with the hotel. Then on our last night of stay at the hotel which was a Friday night. We noticed that there was a strange looking dude standing outside our room with a black toque on. He looked rather intoxicated and we thought he was with the people next door which later turned out not to be true. He told us he was looking for a guy named John and when we told him there was no John in this room he just smiled. About 10mins later as we were leaving to go to the bar he was still outside our room which was definitely a little sketched but again we thought he was with our neighbours as we had seen him talking to them earlier. We left at 11:30pm, and came back early at 1:30am as one of my bud wanted to get money to go to the casino. We found out that our room had been robbed. I lost my laptop along with my DNG Prescription glasses which I had paid over 300$ for! My friend lost his old itouch along with 200$ cash as he had foolishly left his money on the table. The laptop was about 2 years old and probably worth around 400$ but it was not the fact that I lost the laptop but the fact that I had important information in there. Before leaving our room we had nothing to drink and chose to rather drink that night out at the bar making us all sober when we left the room. We had made sure we locked the front door when we left as we had a weird gut feeling about the sketchy individual. We also locked our back balcony door as it is rather easy to hop from one balcony to the other (like a half metre apart). We immediately informed the front desk about what had happened, and he told us that there was no reason to call the police and that the next morning the manager will be in at 10am sharp, and we may be able to get the video footage of who got into our room and go from there. Foolishly we agreed to that and the next morning me and my friend went at 10am sharp to speak to the "manager". When we went there was someone new working and he told us that the manager will not be in till monday! But our check out date was Saturday morning. The man in the front desk the day earlier had lied to us about the manager coming in for Saturday. I then quickly called the Montreal Police who said they will come asap. They came within 10mins but we did not know as the receptionist had told the police that we were staying in a different room. The police had knocked on an empty room to file the report and just as the police got into his car I had asked him if he had come to the hotel regarding a robbery. He said yes and asked why we had not opened our room! I could not believe that the front desk man had lied to the police about our room number so we do not file a police report. But then again the front desk guy may have just made a "mistake". So at the end of all this I finally submitted a police report regarding the robbery and the police informed us that they will check the camera Monday when the manager is back and give me a call when I am back in Toronto. And as if things were not bad enough they got worse. We had prepaid a $50 deposit when we first came to the hotel in the case that we damage anything. We used a prepaid MasterCard to pay. As we were leaving the front desk man took the prepaid card and stated that he had reimbursed our deposit. He gave us a receipt with it and told us that card balance is back to $50. We did not check the receipt and when we went to pump some gas with the money the balance cashier stated the card balance was 0. We called MasterCard to double check the balance and indeed it was 0. This hotel is owned by what I believe thieves. We even have a doubt that we may have been set up by the hotel staff for the robbery. However, I hate to make accusations but all the evidence makes this hotel look bad! I am probably never going to receive any of my goods back and our report will probably end up in the recycling bin. The only good about this hotel was its location and that it was clean (just the rooms and lobby) Apart from that , stay away from this hotel! ps. I have stayed at many hotels/inns before and this has been my worst experience by far! not only because I got robbed but because it seemed as though the hotel staff did not give a dam about it!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: MonikaHonika
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a one night layover coming back from a tropical vacation, loved it! The location was excellent, very close to pubs and shopping on St. Catherine. The beds were super comfortable and staff were really friendly. I would definitly stay here next time I come to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, can get city view, balcony, close to bars and rest.”
Reviews.Author: Hedefors
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Jan. 2012 for business, rooms are remodeled and decent. Can get city view and balcony per request or if AARP over 65. Total AARP rate per night $89.10, or $105.60 with all taxes, a decent value, internet worked well. No parking, it cost $15/night. Lobby was plain, had PC, but no breakfast, coffee only.

Reviews.Title: “central but a bit lacking”
Reviews.Author: biggles51
Reviews.Content: The room was quite contempory but the building itself felt a bit basic. The walls were quite thin and there was a lot of noise from the adjoining room. The hotel, being in the bars/clubs part of Montreal, seemed to attract a lot of younger people who were quite noisy.The interior of the lift was quite scruffy and the lobby area wasn't very smart. However the staff at reception were pleasant and helpful. We were unable to get our t.v. to work properly even though we got a replacement remote from reception. It was impossible to change channels and the volume was too low. There was no breakfast room on site. We were given breakfast vouchers to have our breakfast at the YWCA at the end of the street. The breakfast consisted of a toasted roll with jam and tea or coffee which was rather dull. There was however the option of paying for a different choice of food. We chose to go to Starbucks instead at the other end of the street. The hotel was quite reasonably priced ($99 plus tax)so not sure really if we could have done better. We're not really sure whether we would choose to stay there again. On positive point was that the 747 bus from the airport stopped at the end of the road which cost $8 each. The buses ran frequently - every ten minutes or so I believe. The entrance to the hotel was a death trap. The floor surface was very slippery due to snow being trodden in. At one stage the staff put down some carpet which made it safer but this was not always there.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: mermaid2222
Reviews.Content: If you are planning to party and want to be close to bars then this is the place for you! Don't expect to get to sleep until after the bars close. The room itself was satisfactory and even had a sofa and two queen size beds. The parking was across the street and cost $ 20.00 for the night ($ 25.00 for a pickup)..that includes in and out privileges. The people were very accommodating, but you had to go down to the front desk and get it.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location”
Reviews.Author: TerryinAylmer
Reviews.Content: Quite a reasonable rate for this hotel, located a half block from the shopping district of Montreal, surrounded by interesting pubs and restaurants. Not much to look at from the outside, but the rooms are tastefully decorated, as well as the bathrooms. We stayed in December and found the in-room heater a bit unpredictable, and the balcony door was drafty. Choose the room carefully if you stay in January or February! Remote controls for the TV didn't work ,even with new batteries. Ovwerall worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - few downsides”
Reviews.Author: SClarke13
Reviews.Content: We were in Montreal to do some Christmas shopping, so for us the location was KEY. We were right off St. Catherine's, and also right across the street from a few nice little pubs and eateries, which came in handy. From the outside the hotel looks like a dive, but the rooms are quite nice and modern, and we had no problems with cleanliness or heating - etc. We had 2 rooms between the 6 of us, and neither of our TV remotes worked. We both went down to try to exchange the batteries, were given new ones, still didn't work. Annoying. The receptionist told us if she "found any other remotes she'd come exchange them". Never happened. Another downside is that this is somewhat of a party hotel it seems. Pretty loud drunk people making noise from 11:30pm onward ... Having said that, we still enjoyed our stay, though I'm not 100% sure we'd return..

Reviews.Title: “No frills but pleasant”
Reviews.Author: uacturbo
Reviews.Content: First stayed here in the early 1980s when it was Hotel Crescent, which had been converted from an aging apartment complex. It was tired but good for a few guys enjoying the Montreal nightlife. While looking for a hotel for one night (for wife and myself) recently, I saw this Quality Inn had recently undergone a renovation and decided to try it for $98 CDN. Located on Crescent St. you are in the heart of the nightlife district. Just two blocks from our favourite Indian restaurant, Curry House, on Mackay St. The refurbished rooms are large, with a couch and coffee table and desk. Nice, clean decor. Flat screen TV and a Simmons Beautyrest mattress in the King unit we had. My only complaint would be the loud heater/air conditioning unit. Don't expect any frills here. There are no amenities to speak of, only one ice machine for the building and it's on the first floor, and there is no continental breakfast as advertised on the website. There is coffee in the lobby. For a quick stay - especially for a hockey game as it's close to Bell Centre - I would definitely stay here again at that rate.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading at best...”
Reviews.Author: Ryan S
Reviews.Content: Hey, this hotel's in a great location for sure. That's about where the upside for this place ends. See all that convenient parking at the sides and behind the hotel? Yeah, the lots that HAVE A QUALITY INN SIGN above them saying that guests can park here. Well, it's only when you get inside the lobby where you get to read the (very small) disclaimer on the front desk hidden behind some cheap pamphlets that "the hotel RECOMMENDS those lots, and that they do not own them...in no way is the hotel responsible for damages, theft, or fees. 20 dollars later, thanks for advertising that you have parking for guests. Now to the next lie...See that pretty little pizza place in the lobby? Well, it was never actually open...morning, noon, or night. And hey, look closely at the menu board above the counter. Yes, there are pieces of paper covering the boards showing all the different pizzas this place makes saying "This is not a pizzeria". Hilarious! Not only is it not a pizzeria, its not ANYTHING. Even if it were open, the six or eight people that could be seated in this closet of a restaurant would have to be kicked out after ten minutes to make room for the next customers. Thanks, Quality Inn, for advertising a free continental breakfast that DOESN'T really exist. They couldn't even spring for a vat of coffee and day-old bagels. Hey my room has a balcony! Sweet! Ummm...wait a sec, why does the concrete look so crumbly? Nevermind, I'll just hold on to that rusty, barely attached railing...ummm. nevermind. I never really wanted a balcony anyhow. I'll just close and lock the door to the balcony and pretend it isn't there. Wait a sec...the door doesn't close, let alone lock. That's okay, it's not as though those nimble graffitti artists would open my door while they climb up the side of the building to tag it for the 500th time. When the sweet mercy of daylight came to allow me to check out of this place, I had the pleasure of enjoying one last ride down the elevator that had a fire charred door (oh, yes, rather disconcerting when you have to drop six floors). Then I get out to the (not-the-hotel's) parking lot to get one last admiring look at the myriad of graffiti tags all of over the hotel's back wall, only to find that I had to pick up several shards of glass from the parking lot so as not to be stranded in this place. I can honestly say that I'll stay at a hotel with the owner's name in its title before I ever, ever, stay at ANY Quality Inn again. Heck, if corporate quality control can let this debacle slip by them in a major metropolitan area, they'll let anything slip by them...

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: s121155019
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at this hotel. The room was clean and well maintained, and the staff were very friendly and approachable. The one complaint I would have is that the beds were quite old and uncomfortable. Overall for the price, this is a great location and a fine place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “For the money and location, very decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adam T
Reviews.Content: I kind of was very nervous booking a reservation for this hotel after consulting the reviews here, but was glad I did because overall the hotel was a great deal for the location and price. We were on the top floor and had a beautiful balcony view of downtown Montreal. Pros: -Location (so close to all the great shopping, bars/eateries) -Recently renovated -Not too noisy considering all the bars in the vicinity -Fridge in the room -Comfortable beds -Impressive Wi-Fi. (Seemed to work better on our blackberries as opposed to a laptop.. kept cutting out on the laptop) Cons -The room could have been cleaned better. There were hairs in the bathroom when we arrived, and the toilet didn't appear to be cleaned very well. The tea bags they provided looked ancient. -Elevator was sketchy, and very slow. -Hotel parking in the private lots looked very sketchy and wanted $20 per night. Found cheaper UNDERGROUND parking 2 blocks away. Overall decent experience for what we needed. -

Reviews.Title: “What a change for the better!”
Reviews.Author: Maan77
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel in the past, and it wasn't all that great. But after the renovations, wow! Very classy, clean place for a great price. Will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: Gigs1973
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Montreal about 20 times to attend hockey games. I have stayed at various hotels in the downtown area, ranging from the Marriott to the Travelodge. This hotel is now in my top three. A friend recommended this hotel to me. I booked through the hotel website for the third weekend in October. They have a free loyalty club through the hotel's website that offers discounted stay based upon the number of days until your stay. I booked a room (with a 7-day advanced planning discount) for US $98 (plus QC taxes) that had two queen size beds and a queen size pull-out sofa. The room was nicely furnished with dark wood furniture and very soft carpeting. The beds were very comfortable (medium-hard with a pillow-top) and the bathroom exceeded expectations, complete with hair dryer, massage-type shower head (no tub - just a stall), plenty of towels and the standard amenities. We always had hot-water on demand and the water pressure was strong. There was a 27" flat-screen tv in the room that had a good mix of English and French speaking channels. There was also a single-cup coffee-maker and a leather office-style chair at the desk. There was bottled-water available for $3 for the 1 liter. I bought a 2-liter bottled water at the convenience store across the street for the same price. Our room was on the second floor and did not have a balcony. Looking out our window, we could see all of the Crescent St bars. We could barely hear the noise from them, but this could have been the air conditioner drowning out the sound. Parking was $20 per 24 hours and the lot was directly next to the hotel. This lot provided us in/out access and no tipping was necessary. Checking in was a breeze. Upon check-in, they gave us the password to access the free wifi. My friend used the wifi with his smartphone and he seemed satisfied with it. The front desk always had smiling employees and they were very helpful about providing directions and even a plunger, on request. Checking out was also very easy, but they did not offer express check-out like you so often find in the US. The hotel does not have a pool or a fitness center. There were no vending machines at the hotel and the ice machine was near the lobby. There was a computer in the front desk area that we used to check times for movie listings. They could make this computer area a bit more private and definitely more comfortable. The computer is at waist height, facing everyone, and there is no chair available for it. The location is great if visiting the Bell Centre or the downtown area is where you want to be. It's a block to Starbucks, St. Catherine's St, and plenty of shopping. There is a movie theater (and the mall) about five blocks away. Both the Peel and Guy-Concordia Metro stations are about 4 blocks away. The Bell Centre is about 3 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor Quality "in"”
Reviews.Author: rodriarano
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Quality Inn Downtown in Montreal from the 6th to the 10th of October (that's from thursday to monday). I book one room through Expedia using it's Unpublished Rates (if you don't know what that is, go check it out since it's totally worth it). As I titled this review, it's necessary to highlight the good location of this hotel. You will be on Crescent St between the commercial St-Catherine (the best part of the street) and Rene Levesque. So you can access everywhere walking: the shopping area, the financial area, the beautiful Mont Royal (from which you can have probably the best view of the town), and also the Vieux-Montreal and Vieux-Port. However, this central location has one drawback: noise. Specially on weekends (plus a holiday!) the nice bars and restaurants with terraces are super crowded and you will hear the noise from you room. This might or might not be an inconvenience for you... if you walked all day long, be sure you will fall asleep as soon as you touch the pillow. The hotel seems to have been refurbished very recently. The room had all brand new furniture, with those excellent, hard-to-get-up-in-the-morning Simmons Beautyrest, a modern LCD TV with broad choice of cable channels, a desk with comfortable chair, and fine lamps with plugs on them. The bathroom was acceptable, nice big bath with shower, a big counter with space to put your toiletries, and a wall-sized mirror. All the rooms have balcony and a good heating / air conditioning system. Our fare included 'breakfast'. They given you a coupon to go to the bar in the corner to have a coffee and a baguette. Judge by yourself. (us we've only been once) My 'poor Quality "in"' statement is related to some issues we experience during the stay: - Noise: as I said before, it was quite bothering the first night (we had just checked in); it might have been the fact that we were on the 8th floor and the noise goes up (?); - Not-locking door!: we realized that the door of the room was not locking automatically; one night when we came back from the restaurant, I pushed the door and could open it without using the card! (this happened a second time after the room cleaning was made). We were quite bothered by this, since we were leaving all our belongings in the room during the day; at the front desk they told us it was because of the paint they used in the recent refurbish. Conclusion, you need to slam the door to make sure it's closed and locked. - Room key: they are cards as everywhere nowadays, but twice they were not working and we had to go get them re-done: in both times, they just gave us a new cards with even asking us any prove that we were the occupants of the room. This might have something to do with the door problem. - Cleaning: first day, the cleaning was very good we met the maid and she was very nice. After that, the room was not deeply clean anymore (though I guess fair enough). Last day, the woman left us a message saying that "because of the weekend + holiday" she couldn't leave us more towels (we were 3). We had to go ask for towels downstairs. Also the amenities, like shampoo and conditions, were not enough. - Free Internet: dreadful. Very slow. You can try using another free network you can catch. - Staff: some of them were very nice, some others seemed bothered to be asked about something. I guess this is normal in a 2-star hotel. Conclusion: It might not we the best hotel in town (surely not, there are amazing hotel in Montreal), it's a 2 star, with cheap fares, you cannot really ask much out of it. In my opinion, is good for a short stay and if you are simple and are not looking for much luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Has promise”
Reviews.Author: JustinConnors
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for very cheap. Got the room for 90 dollars, which is a steal in Montreal. We entered the lobby which threw me off as it was a pizza place with ovens/menus all in tact. I learned that it was there temporary lobby as the new one was being re done. Our room was great. Very large for being in a big city. One thing that I think people should know is that this is on crescent street which is party central for montreal. We didn't have too much trouble with the party crowd and honestly did not hear anything all night despite our rooms facing the bars. The bed was probably the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in which really surprised me. We were in town for a Canadiens game and I would def recommend this for fans coming in for a quick game. Mins from bell centre, mins from st catherines, great price. I would stay again with the boys, probably not with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and Dirty”
Reviews.Author: MTBeeZ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for three nights when we were in town for a film festival. While our room was in adequate condition, we were extremely disappointed with the condition of the hotel lobby, the elevators, and the hallways. The elevators and hallways reeked of beer, and there were bottle caps and empty bottles lying around. There were large groups of drunken teenagers partying in neighboring rooms and in the hallways until late in the night, making it difficult to sleep. And unfortunately, the hotel management was unable to get the situation under control. To be fair, we did find the housekeeping and front desk staff to be polite and friendly, and management did give us a discount for the inconveniences we experienced. However, unless you are young and looking for a place to party, I could not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Continued Unauthorized Charges to My Capital ONE Credit Card”
Reviews.Author: MJ M
Reviews.Content: I would like to recommend that no one ever give their credit card number to this organization. I signed a Quality Inn consent form authorizing $150. + tax to pay for an additional night at the downtown Montreal location. I was assured that all other charges, for previous nights, had been paid by my son's friend. However, my CAPITAL ONE credit was billed over $500. initially and re-billed $383. While head office initially offered to help, the Downtown Montreal management refuses to return my calls and has never produced a document indicating what the charges are for. This, in my books, is theft.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Price for Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Molokairaceofficial
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time I have stayed in this hotel in 3 years. The rooms are renovated and the bathrooms clean and modern. The problem with this property is that as it is a great value for downtown Montreal it seems like many college kids stay here on the weekends. They really trash the place (elevators and exterior) and are noisy when they return (usually around 4AM). The location is excellent for restaurants, bars and the metro. The staff is always very friendly and accommodating. Parking is $20.00 per day but very easy to get your car in and out as we found necessary to get to the track every day. Many hotels downtown make it virtually impossible to get your car under a half an hour once you park. I always come to Montreal on business but I find the restaurants on Rue Crescent great and an easy walk from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it, even at half-price!”
Reviews.Author: MizzM1234
Reviews.Content: I was able to snag a last minute deal for this hotel at booking.com for 1 night Saturday in July at half-price. Location is convenient to Rue St. Catherine, which is the main avenue for shopping. Room is renovated, but the floor elevator lobby is not - no floor finish, peeling wall paper. I could not make the a.c. unit remain on so as to cool the room - turns itself off even if the room is still warm. Only one person manning the front desk at all times, even at check-out time. Felt sorry for the person in front of me who paid full price.Very glad to to move out of hotel. Had to call them one week after my stay because they failed to release hold on my cc. My hotel tip: south of Rue St. Catherine - major seediness is normal. Go north and the difference is night & day - very classy.

Reviews.Title: “downtown hotel not recommended with kids very noise environment”
Reviews.Author: bhavin_nc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in downtown, all the bars and clubs are around the hotel. so you will hear all noise and distraction whole day and night. People go to clubs and bars during nights come back to room for stay but with lots of noise. I would not recommended it if you are traveling with kids. Also hotel advertise with free breakfast, actually they don't have any kitchen, they provide a voucher worth of only $4 to near by restaurant. But you can get only a bread and coffee for $4 bucks. When hotel advertise you expect to have a full unlimited breakfast. Parking is also not available for free, CAD$20.00 for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Currently undergoing renovations, great visit!”
Reviews.Author: Jammel71
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend for 6 nights (we booked through hotwire), and we were welcomed at the front desk with our keys, saying that we got a newly-renovated room. We were skeptical about the hotel, given the mediocre reviews, but for the value, you can't beat it! Our way up to the room was a little skeezy. The elevators were a bit of a mess (on our ride up, the couple riding with us warned us that we ought to check to see if there are people staying in our room already; apparently, they had a bit of a mishap when they were given keys to a room that was already occupied!), our hallway on the 3rd floor was literally falling apart, but our room was absolutely gorgeous! I have never stayed in a nicer room for as cheap as we paid for it. We took the train in to Montreal, and it was quite easy to find the hotel and a short walk to the metro. There was often coffee in the lobby (though we never took advantage of it), and the front desk staff were quite friendly. Definitely would recommend, though I can't say anything about the un-renovated rooms! Looks like they're making progress, as the downstairs conference room was filled to the brim with new furniture. (My cleanliness rating is based on the overall cleanliness of the hotel. Our room couldn't have been better.)

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will definitely be back soon!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel R
Reviews.Content: I am the receptionist at a hotel in the same chain in Quebec City, and I was very pleased with my stay at the Quality Inn. We went for a girls trip (all 3 of us had bad breakups at the same time. haha.) we checked into the hotel early. Which was wonderful, I understand how annoying it is, when people arrive early for their rooms earlier than check-in and the receptionist was wonderful. And we were greeted perfectly by the staff every time I asked a dumb question or something like that. The reception was wonderful all 4 of them!!!! It is less than 30 seconds walking distance from the action on Ste-Catherine, great for shopping. Also, night life is wonderful! less than 2 blocks from at least 4 great bars. Food is very close. The balconies were great for getting fresh air and the view was amazing! I really appreciated that. I didnt eat the continental breakfast so I cannot comment on that. Overall, WE LOVED IT! We will definitely be back more often. =)).

Reviews.Title: “Better inside than out”
Reviews.Author: KGill
Reviews.Content: We booked one night at the Quality Inn downtown, because we had early mroning travel plans, and needed easy access to the 747 bus. It was a Saturday night at the end of July, there were at least three festivals in town, and hotel rooms were extremely scarce. We knew that hotels on Crescent Street do not cater to families - it's a party street - but that was fine, as we just needed a place to spend the night. It was expensive - $207 with taxes - but it was literally the only room we could find in the downtown area (and we only got our room because I checked just as someone canceled their reservation). The exterior of the hotel was not promising, and the lobby didn't offer much encourgement, either. The elevator was scary - as in, "don't touch the walls" scary - and tiny, but it did the job. Two empty 24 cases in the hallway built on the SRO theme. However, once we opened the door to our room, we were pleased - the room was large, clean, and nicely decorated. I would guess that the hotel is undergoing renovations, and that they've started with the guest rooms. The room had two queen-sized beds (extremely comfortable) , a desk, a large flat-screen TV on a dresser, an armchair, and a coffee maker (which was missing its carafe, but we got a replacement). No fridge. We also had a balcony, which looked out onto rue Crescent, which my husband appreciated - he struck up a running conversation with some guys from the room next foor, who were in town for a stag party (they apologized in advance for the noise - but hey, it was a Saturday night on Crescent). We left very early in the morning, so I didn't check out the breakfast. I got a much better night's sleep than I had expected, even with the stag party happening all around us, and got to my bus without a hitch.

Reviews.Title: “It was decent. Good for the money.”
Reviews.Author: SMc2727
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a girls trip. The hotel was a little old and dingy but it was a good location. The elevator was a little scary and the hotel was out-dated but the rooms were clean. The buffet wasn't very good, but what do you expect for a free breakfast? Overall it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “convenient”
Reviews.Author: Doggerm
Reviews.Content: This Motel was actuually nicer than I expected,, its clean, service is good, staff very fluent in English and French. Located near the highway, I would stay here again. only problem is elevator is a little slow, restaurant IN the hotel is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Obviously in renovations, great location.”
Reviews.Author: kal_87
Reviews.Content: Although this is a cheap hotel and is undergoing renovations, I really don't think there is ANY excuse for a hotel to peeling wallpaper, a clogged tub (so bad that you have to rush your shower to ensure it doesn't overflow) and filthy carpets. The balcony was great to overlook the streets and have a beer, but this place was on par with some of the crappy hostels I stayed in while in Europe. It's okay if you are looking for zero frills or perks, and perhaps good for a group of young friends to party, go bar hopping, and see a Canadians game. An outdoor parking lot is available across the street for a price, but it's overcharged as it's just a dirt lot and a wood panel booth with no security. It is close to a lot of Montreal hot spots so that's another plus for young people.

Reviews.Title: “Brutal .”
Reviews.Author: Stevekoroll
Reviews.Content: This place was basically awful in every way except The location is good if you are there for the bars. Restaurant/pub directly across the street is good. broken divider in room , and gross bedding. I went there with 7 friends just to party and drink and we all still agreed we would never go back and spend more for a nicer place. I would not recommend to anyone really, especially a family !!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel in downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Tacpatriot
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff and stay were fine. Be careful of the parking lot outside as there are many homeless and such wandering about. These wanderers did not bother me personally, only when they broke into my truck through the back window. The checks, ID and personal stuff was left behind as only the street survival stuff was taken. My raincoat, sneakers, knife and money were taken. The thieves only took what they needed for the street and did not mess with the other stuff. The hotel is a sort of in the middle of a big street and has some nice places around it. I would stay at the hotel again if I made sure that it was known that I did not have stuff in my auto.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty in the room about room service but there wasn't any.”
Reviews.Author: footloose888
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation well ahead of time and was given a conformation number for my reservation which they didn't ask to see. When I got into my room there was a large air conditioning unit in the middle of the carpet. I was given another room for four hours and then had to change rooms again. The room I was in by 6pm, after checking in during teh afternoon was full of noise from a next door bar from 10pm to 2am, plus there was plenty of street noise also. I was moved to the top floor. Nice room, but when I tried to use room service I was told to come downstairs to order...? So I went downstairs and leaned there was no room service. No breakfast of bacon and eggs available as per the menu in the room. There would be a free croissant and a coffee. There would also be pizza, but no subs or other items on the menu in the restaurant in the hotel lobby annex. I left before my full number of days was up, feeling less than satisfied with my overall experience. No room service with rooms topping 100 bucks a night is a monumental insult to all the hotels customers.

Reviews.Title: “I feel bad for the staff”
Reviews.Author: np13_87
Reviews.Content: This hotel is actually pretty old, but is quaint. Its undergoing renovations at the moment, so its likely to take a long time to fix. The new rooms are lovely, spacious and comfy. The staff obviously does the best with what they have to work with, their management should be very thankful for them! They're the best part about that place. The owners of this hotel should do more about this place. There are young people working there overnight ALONE... on crescent street on both the weekends and during the week..! During the week it's a YOUNG GIRL! horrible. If that were my daughter I would not allow that! Overall, if you're looking for a party hotel, this is your best bet. hopefully that changes.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was the most disgusting and dirty hotel that we have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: thompsonlaw
Reviews.Content: There is no way I would ever recommend this hotel. My husband and I could not believe the state of the hotel. It appeared that it was frequented by hookers, pimps and drug dealers. It was so dirty and so disgusting that we slept in our clothes on top of the bed.

Reviews.Title: “GRIM! A candidate for the world's worst name-brand property!”
Reviews.Author: WMichiganTraveler
Reviews.Content: This may have been the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. It looks like it was built at the time of the 1967 Montreal World Expo, and has not been rehabilitated since. In fact, I am not sure the carpet in the hall has even been cleaned since 1967. Guest room: 1/ carpet old and tired; 2/ light bulb in 1light burned out; 3/ desk chair was so foul, I put a towel down before I sat in it; 4/ window sills and door to "balcony" looked like they had not been cleaned in 6 months; 5/ clocks on table, and TV were off by about 15 minutes. One good thing, the sheets were clean, and the bed cover SEEMED clean. Bathroom: 1/ Tiny; 2/ cheap plastic around sink with at least 10 cigarette butt burns. Bathroom was clean Customer Service: Lobby area is, to put it sweetly, dated. Staff were more interested in talking to their friends than in helping a person trying to check in. I requested a wake-up call, which did not come, so had to pay an over-charge for parking. The hotel is in a great location, but really should be imploded.

Reviews.Title: “They left out the quality in this inn”
Reviews.Author: flandaz
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beat, right on Ste Cathe's and Crescent and the room was large and spacious. The balcony had a neat view of the street. The room was clean and the bed was very comfy. The room was dated and the carpet had old stains and burns. My criticisms are that the attention to function isn't there. the shower ceiling was peeling, and the tub was a bath-fitter job that had lifted from the base, so I almost toppled over when stepping in. The shower head ran cold water and the tap hot....and that was how you shower! The elevator broke down, it was fixed within several hours. It is a bit of a 'party' hotel, lots of younger people there to party in mtl it seems. Overall, it is not a "nice" hotel, but it will do if you aren't picky, and just want a clean bed and downtown location.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel on the Planet!”
Reviews.Author: Shanook17
Reviews.Content: I can't believe how disgusting the two rooms my friends and I stayed in were. We all agreed we didn't even know how it they were allowed to keep this place open! The following are the many reasons for our disgust: 1: One room smelt like someone had just smoked an entire pack on cigarettes in it while the other smelt my a musty, mildrew basement. 2. There were stains all over the room including on the floors, walls beds and even the ceiling. 3. The walls had numerous holes as well as the wallpaper was ripped in many sports. 4. There was at least one electrical outlet that was falling out of the wall. 5. Over half the lights did not work in one of the room. 6. The tv didn't work in the same room the lights didn't work in. 7. The closet door was made out of mirror and it had a large crack in the glass. 8. The molding on a divider was falling off. 9. The bathroom ceiling was peiling and very dated fictures. It was also not very clean. 10. The beds had huges sunken holes in it. Also the bedspreads had the texture and look of a burlap sack. I'm sure there were other things wrong but that's all I can think of at this time. I would never stay here again and would advise no one else does either!!

Reviews.Title: “Save Yourself the Hassle Dont Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Chucker16
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one evening. One evening too....long. Upon check in, requested parking in the hotel underground parking. Staff said none was avaliable. Asked where I could park, said there was parking avaliable behind the hotel. $17.00 same as underground. Had to pay! so car was close as we planned on going out a few times. Staff made a point of mentioning they were not responsible for damage and anything left in the car. Boy were they right. Next morning came out to car and it was broken into. When I reported it to the front desk and the hotel manager, said there was nothing they could do. Extremely uncooperative as this looks like a regular occurance. Stay far away from this Hotel Chain, looking after guests and helping them means nothing!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Price, but thats it!”
Reviews.Author: sparklys
Reviews.Content: My friend and i stayed here in August 2010, we were two female travelers, traveling alone. We were really concerned about reading the other reviews from past travelers but we took the risk anyway. It turned out that the hotel is mostly full of loud students and the loud music on friday and saturday nights dont stop until 5 in the morning.. literaly! On the first night we were there 30 mins to arriving there was a huge drunken fight in the lobby. This is NOT a place for small children during the weekends. During the week it is a whole lot safer, so if you are not a PARTY student avoid the weekends. The beds were surprisingly very clean and we both had very nice sleeps. the beds were the best part of the hotel. however you must wear shoes in the hotel room because otherwise the bottom of your feet will turn 'black' from walking barefoot in the room. On the last night of staying there we were checking under beds to make sure had not forgotten anything, and there was left over pizza under our bed with several pop bottels, so clearly the maid doesn't do to much work. EWW! Staff were really great! and helped with everything we needed

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Bad Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Astreleda
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at this hotel: really dirty lobby and elevetor, it is full of young people/student drank and noisy. A terrible smell of smoke in the rooms, dirty windows and noisy, walls damaged. The Car park is an abandoned space, open and not secure (even if you pay 20 CAD per night) but we was lucky and our car was safe. One of our room had no hairdryer and lights did'nt work and after 2 days none came to fix them. Ony 2 positive comments: 1) the rooms were better then the lobby, quite clean and large and 2) the location: it is really in the center of Montreal, full of pub and restaurant etc. Not reccomended for family, best for young people with no particulat expectation or needs.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: nynyhome
Reviews.Content: It seems that the front desk clerks at this hotel got lost on their way to their real jobs at a five-star hotel (they were that gracious). Everything else about this place was the stuff of nightmares. Our teen-age daughter began whining at the sight of the exterior, but since we had a reservation (and because I know just how difficult a Montreal hotel room is to come by), I insisted. Tired travelers, we quickly passed through a tiny but reasonably neat lobby (where a bottle of reed diffusers enveloped the front desk in pleasant fragrance), into a filthy elevator whose door opened onto an equally unappealing dark and dingy hallway. As we unlocked the room door, a heavy, musty smell greeted us. From the entry we could see that both double beds had concave mattresses. Carpeting was stained, as were the bedspreads. In the bathroom we discovered moldy grout , and peeling wallpaper. Where the promised hairdryer might have been, only a metal backplate remained. We brought the odor to the attention of the desk clerk who promised an ozone machine while we went out. She stopped us on our return to say that she'd found us a newly renovated room on another floor. Same elevator, same type of hallway, but, indeed, a newly renovated room. Quite adequate for the price. And, guess what? The missing hairdryer seemed to have made its way to our new bathroom counter. Without its wall plate, it was, as yet, uninstalled. In the morning, I did find used soap, a personal body wash, and a public hair on the bathtub ledge. Cleaned up and managed to put it out of my mind while we obtained our breakfast vouchers for the adjoining pizza joint where were offered a semblance of a continental breakfast. So, as I say, "Au revoir Quality Inn," I'm hoping that we will get to meet those lovely desk clerks again next year, when the Montreal Ritz-Carlton reopens!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel, just say "no"”
Reviews.Author: Turist12
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this horrible hotel for two nights. Trust me, it is as bad as the reviews say it is. Dirty, noisy and stuffy. It is impossible to get sleep here either because of the noise outside or because your neighbors are having a party till 4 in the morning. Management does not care what takes place. We had two rooms and this hotel and one was worse than the other. The window was knocked out, the hair drier used to be white a long time ago and is now covered in grime, the toilet was running...Nasty, dirty carpeting...This hotel should be leveled to the ground and then re-built from scratch, that's how bad it is. Don't stay here if you can help it. We got this hell hall on priceline. Parking is $20/night.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: Spacey64
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here unless you don't mind a dirty room with a dirty elevator - hard to keep kids from touching absolutely nothing. The breakfast provided was ok - but they wouldn't give us cream cheese with our bagel as this is not included. The coffee was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Average Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: call_gaurav
Reviews.Content: Hi, I had traveled to Montreal for a business trip during July 2010. I was booked in Hotel Quality Inn downtown, Montreal. As the name suggests, it is situated in the downtown area of Montreal, next to the key highway of Montreal city. This hotel being a budget hotel, I did not have much expectations except for clean rooms and washroom. I was disappointed on both counts. The room was average size but had a distinct bad odour. Same with the washroom. It seemed that the room has been modified or constructed in haste as the aesthetics did not seem correct. For e.g. the work table was right next to the air conditioner, which means you are right in front of the AC blower when you are working on the table. Another example, the washroom door was touching the commode cap when you try to close it. Inside the room, i had free high speed wi-fi connection which was as expected. Most surprisingly, there were bugs on my bed and in the pillow covers. As mentioned earlier there was a unique misty smell in the room throughout. The breakfast was the most disappointing as it did not have any option. There were hardly 4-5 items and they were also served very late in the morning. For a business traveler it is important that the breakfast be done by 7-7.30 am. However, when we entered the breakfast room we observed that they were only setting it up. There were only limited items like freezed boiled eggs, bread, coffee and fruits. thats it. The parking space was also lacking as once or twice we had to find parking space outside the hotel premises. Reception staff was courteous and helpful. The hotel had a few nice places at walking distance thus food and shopping was not a problem. Overall, I would rate the hotel as very average and not much value for money. They can do much better if they can take care of the cleanliness of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “if u dont get your room really for pennies go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: charles750
Reviews.Content: i was in for grand prix week thou it was good location for night life but the service was terrible maybe they were overbooked and the smell of the food in the hotel all day long makes you hungry so if you are on a diet not recommended the breakfast was a bagel and a coffee that taste terrible anyway the only good i could find was the location if you dont want to sleep

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Mediocre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jgaskins43
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Quality Inn Montreal for the Candadian Grand Prix. The best thing about this hotel is its location. We were 1/2 block from St. Catherine's where most of the nighttime street parties were going on. Also we were about 2 blocks from the Metro station. The staff were very friendly but the hotel looked to be an old apartment building. The furnishings were dated and the AC worked but froze up a lot. The beds were very short, but luckily so am I. It also seemed a little expensive, but we were there for the race and the F1 circus so the room was not that important.

Reviews.Title: “worst travel experience”
Reviews.Author: mikeoklahoma
Reviews.Content: i had bad travel experience in the past but nothing like this, this place from beginning to end is horrible , especially the pizza place in it with the smell of pizza all over the place and the taste is even worse.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to smell Pizza all time, this is the perfect place!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Brigitte66
Reviews.Content: All what I can add over the others reviews it was the smell of Pizza in the room all time. Besides all the bad things in this hotel, there is a Pizzeria in the hotel which make it worse and worse, smelling Pizza even when sleeping

Reviews.Title: “Character and fun.”
Reviews.Author: ThE_pOeMiSt
Reviews.Content: This place was fantastic. Booked the hotel without reading the trip advisor reviews, and then stumbled across them before coming to montreal. If you read these reviews, I think a normal person would be terrified. Needless to say I'm not a normal person. I was fired up to see this train-wreck in person, and I was not let down one bit! "Not worth the money!" "Crack House?" loved those reviews, but I found the staff was very helpful even replacing my broken remote three times in a row! We were dying laughing! Well my female was, but i was just simply dying of short breath from the walk down to the lobby each time, since the elevator moved slower than my grandma.... and shes been dead since 1997. If your looking for a place thats clean but still has the essence of a crack den, then this place will entertain you to no end. The AC worked fine unlike what the other review said, actually so fine that it let us know it was on the whole time with its Turbo Charged fan system that could be heard for miles! LOVED IT.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: browneyedgirl222
Reviews.Content: Montreal is a beautiful city and this hotel is right in the middle of everything,lose to Concordia University and there is plenty to do within walking distance,streets are lined with pubs and places to eat. I checked online and at the 800 number for Quality Inn and was assured that there was no deposit upon arriving at the hotel, but there is a 50.00 deposit along with the cost of the hotel. I think this is very important for travelers to know. They claim they are doing renovations. The room was very large,but there was mold in the bathroom.The walls are very very thin and I could hear the couple next door having very loud sex as their headboard banged loudly against the wall. Not to mention,it is located across the street from a row of pubs and there was so much noise from the people outside,it was hard to sleep. It seemed like a safe area.The staff was nice but I probably will not stay there again. This hotel is better for younger people who will be out most of the time and who don't mind loud drunks and other couples having sex loudly while you are trying to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “great place for the boys, not family”
Reviews.Author: cwmac00
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights to catch hockey games and the superbowl with 17 other budies. Rooms are banged up and they are under renovation but a great place for a party. Rooms are huge and we had no problem fitting in 15 guys without being crowded. We had music playing until the wee hours of the morning and hotel staff never bothered us once. They were very helpful when needed. Location is excellent, walking distance to everything. Would recommend for a weekend get away with the boys but would upgrade if I were bringing the famil along.

Reviews.Title: “Crack House?”
Reviews.Author: eddie2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about location only. Rooms are in very bad condition, common areas are only a little better. Hasn't been updated in 15-20 years, also last time the hotel was cleaned. T.V didn't work, heater didn't work, staff didn't work. Only plus, close to almost everything (train station, Bell Centre, tons of bars) Not worth the savings, spend $30 more a night and stay at a different hotel. Only stay here if you are spending most of your time out of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price, fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Jaabeck321
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed in Montreal for a week this past October, as a last minute getaway. We weren't interested in spending a lot of money on our hotel, as we knew we would be out and about most of the time. We chose the Quaily Inn for it's location, which as it turned out, was perfect. There are three pleasant pubs within ten strides of the lobby. I would strongly suggest Brutopia (right across the street) for some excellently crafted micobrews and live entertainment. Also, the MadHatter (next door) has very good pub chow and great drink specials ( three shots for $10). There are plenty of other establishments just a short walk away as well. Great shopping, dining, and galleries were all within walking distance. The hotel itself honestly exceeded out expectations. The staff was helpful and friendly. The room was spacious and had a nice balcony. The bathroom could use a update, but was clean and functional. The beds we large, clean and comfortable. Perfectly acceptable for a $90 a night lodging. The parking across the street was expensive ($20 a night), but parking every where is expensive ( it IS a CITY). Overall I would recommend Quality to anyone who is traveling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: beanspotpgh
Reviews.Content: This was about a mile from Old Town, so definitely walkable. The front desk was pleasant and helpful with recommendations. The room was clean and neat and they had nice extra touches towels folded in a pretty display. The grocery store across the street was great. Only complaint stayed on a Wednesday near to no restaurants open past 9:30. Parking was only 13 american for the day a steal in montreal

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable beds, old & needs updating badly”
Reviews.Author: CanadaC
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a good price & great location, this is a great choice. It was my first visit to Montreal and we were only there for 1 night, but we slept soundly (one of us used earplugs as it is a noisy street with Irish themed bars). I'm pretty sure some young guys got into a bit of a verbal fight in room across from us - I heard swearing & shouting late at night, but I really did sleep well otherwise. The ceiling was peeling a bit in the bathroom (but not like falling on people or anything), one of the chairs had stains on it, and I suspect the hide-a-bed was old and uncomfortable (we had a room with 2 double beds & a love seat that folded out - but there were only 3 of us, so didn't need the hide-a-bed). The tub in the bathroom was also a bit weird - it seemed like it had been re-done with a tub liner over an old tub and water would get under it (between the tub and liner) and so it would feel squishy under your feet. The sheets were clean, the beds were comfortable and the price & location was right. There was a free breakfast (bagel, toast or croissant plus tea or coffee) but we were hungry and didn't want to wait in line for it. Great place for students or other young people to stay. Had great service from the front desk staff. They let us check-in several hours early and stored our bags in a secured room for us after we checked out so we could go site-seeing without having to carry them around all day.

Reviews.Title: “Time to demolish this one and build anew.”
Reviews.Author: WindsorTraveller
Reviews.Content: Spent two weekend nights here recently; the place is filthy in the common areas and just clean in the the rooms. The bedding and curtains and rugs are worn and shabby. Our room had mirrored doors for the closet but one mirror was cracked. Older type TV's, no fridge in the room, no free breakfast, mould in the bathroom. Slow, slooooow elevators. Parking is $25 per night across the street, none available at the hotel. The rooms are average hotel size, the a/c was fine, there is a balcony but they tell you not to go out on it after 11 at night. Great location for a Quality Inn, but they should be ashamed their name is on this one.

Reviews.Title: “great location, crappy otherwise”
Reviews.Author: cfw27
Reviews.Content: GREAT location at a decent price - that's why you would stay here. otherwise, you wouldn't. also a convenient garage downstairs for $15 a night. the lobby and the whole hotel in general smelled strongly of bad, cheap perfume. free internet connection was available, but very poor quality. room not very well ventilated, bathroom smelled sort of urine-like, room was generally dingy and worn-looking. Importantly though, it was clean. and great pillows!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Maan77
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about the location. We drove into town and the hotel is 2 blocks from the highway, and a block from the centre of everything. From shopping on St. Catherine street to Old Montreal, it was all accessible within a few minutes of walking. Rooms were quite large and offered free high-speed internet. And the pizza place on the main floor was excellent. Although we were not there for the nightlife, all around you could see the bars and clubs were within walking distance for anyone heading to Montreal for that purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a good location at a decent price”
Reviews.Author: Arrege
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the heart of downtown Montreal really close to restaurants, pubs, Metro etc. The Hotel lobby is small but clean. The front desk is well informed, friendly and helpful. The hallways on our floor were kind of old and worn. The elevator itself was kind of old and worn and poorly lit. The room faced the rear of the building so there was not a lot of street noise. There was also a balcony that looked on to the rear parking lot. Each floor only had a few hotel rooms. The room was large, well kept and well lit. There is no fridge here and the internet access is Free but not wireless...only an ethernet connection. The room was a good deal for the price. Large king bed, adequate space, decent bathroom. The whole lobby and elevator often smell like pizza since there is a pizzeria connected to the hotel that delivers to guests in the rooms as well. Note about parking: If you go thru the Hotel, you will pay $20 per night for overnight parking in a an open lot right next to the Hotel. We lucked out since we found a hotel about 1 block away. You can negotiate about a $6 rate for overnight parking. Street parking is free (right in front of the hotel) after 9 pm on weekdays till 8 am the next day. This is a lot cheaper than the Hotel parking.

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: davidhjChicago
Reviews.Content: Much better than I expected for the price and in a delightful area of Montreal near shops and terrific restaurants. Parking possible on street but a little hard to deduce how the parking meter pay system works. Adjacent parking lots not all that expensive. Nice, real breakfast available for under $10 Canadian.. Not fancy by any means but very cheap

Reviews.Title: “Pretty shoddy.”
Reviews.Author: biscuitbarrel
Reviews.Content: This place is tatty and rather run down even though the room was large and the wired internet worked well. The hotel clearly runs on a tight budget, I gather they subcontract catering, the breakfast was a classic mug of coffee and prehistoric bagel. All this might have been tolerable because I thought it would be cheap. My colleagues and I had booked this hotel at a special conference rate. My colleague paid the bill and did not point out that they were charging some 50 canadian dollars per day more than the conference rate. I stayed on an extra day and when I came to pay I pointed out that they were charging more than the agreed rate and they were extremely unhelpful and uncooperative. I don't know if this over charging was an 'error' or not. I can say, however, that we could have stayed in a pleasant hotel for the price we ended up paying. On balance this is one to avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!!!”
Reviews.Author: ktb_8
Reviews.Content: As I looked for reviews before my trip, I was confused because there were not a of current ones. So I just wanted to pass along some feedback to help fellow travelers choose a hotel for their visit to Montreal. Initially I was scared because there were not a lot of reviews, but the location was amazing and that's what made me finally decide to book it. Our room was on the 14th floor-facing Crescent St- and what a view it was! We had one king size bed, and a couch. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. They kept our luggage after we checked out, as we had a late flight, and they called the airport shuttle and made our reservation. The housekeeping staff was friendly and helpful as well. The room and bathroom was clean and we had no concerns about walking around in our bare feet. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great place to stay in an amazing location!

Reviews.Title: “If you think more than just location is important in a hotel don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: kimberlyGTA
Reviews.Content: Before I write this review about the quality inn downtown Montreal I would like to describe the type of person I am because often times when reading a review you don't know if the person complaining is just an uptight middle aged man! My friends and I are 23 year old European girls from Toronto who enjoy shopping, sight seeing and a vibrant nightlife with great house music and fair prices. We are not high maintenance but want a place thats clean, safe and has a friendly, helpful staff! (I don't think that's too much to ask!). The pros of the hotel are as follows: -Amazing location: a one minute walk to St. Catherine St, the best place to shop, full of boutiques and the underground city (a bunch of malls connected to each other underground). The downside, there is a strip club almost directly in front of the hotel and a dirty alley way right beside the hotel. -Some of the staff is friendly, greeted us with a smile, gave us some helpful tips on where to shop, eat etc - The noise issue people complained about was not our experience, it was pretty quiet so don't worry about that. Just make sure you get a room that faces the back of the hotel. -This hotel does hold onto your bags even after you've checked out. We had a late flight and i didn't want to carry all of our luggage around so they held onto them free of charge. -This hotel has a shuttle that will take you from central station to the hotel free of charge, however you have to pay to take the bus from the airport to central station which is $24 there and back which they don't tell you about on the website and is a bit confusing when you arrive in Montreal for the first time and don't know where to go! and that's it! Now here are the cons, bare with me there are many!! -Our initial room was disgusting! It smelled terrible, was dirty and the worst thing was that the sheets were stained with something that resembled blood. I am not joking this is the truth!. We called front desk to complain and they moved us to another room, the room right next door! The appropriate thing to do was to upgrade us for the trouble, we already were paying $120 per night Canadian to stay in this place, the least they could do was offer us a better space. -The room we stayed in appeared better in the beginning. The sheets were clean. But upon inspection, the bottom of the shower curtain had black muck on the bottom of it, the wallpaper was peeling in the washroom and so was the paint on the ceiling above the shower! The windows were dirty, the hinges to the door that leads to the balcony was rusted and the railing of the balcony looked like it was about 200 years old. The couch had white stains on it and the carpet was grimy to say the least. DON'T walk bare foot on the carpet or in the bathroom! Even the carpet in the elevator had stains on it like someone got sick on it the night before and stained it! -As we headed out to check out the nightlife we asked the front desk what time we had to be up in the morning so our room could be cleaned. They told us anytime before 2pm. So the next morning we were out of our room by noon. We crossed paths with the cleaning crew on our floor as we were leaving. They asked us if we needed service and we did and they said they would take care of our room for us. When we got back to our room at around 7pm our room had NOT been cleaned! Our dirty towels were still in a pile in the tube as was asked so that the cleaning crew would know to change them, the garbages were not replaced, our old bed linens were still on the bed, nothing was done! We could not believe this!!! We called front desk and they told us that they would see what they could do. 15 minutes later a guy showed up with 2 fresh towels! That's it, 2 towels! can you believe it! we had to call front desk again and ask for more towels. We did receive more but that should not have been the end of our service. We needed more toilet paper, garbages had to be emptied, the shower needed to be cleaned and we needed new bed linens. We did receive new bed linens with the second round of towels that we had to put on our bed ourselves. I did not know that when you pay $120 per night, for a total of two nights that we would have to make our own bed! This is suppose to be our vacation. A vacation in Canada, a first world country that I would assume world have higher standards and better service. I have been to resorts in third world countries and received first class service all the way by EVERYONE at the resort! This was embarrassing! -That night we went out to party and when we came back we decided to get some pizza from the shop that was attached to the hotel. However the door that attached the pizza place to the hotel was locked! At first we were angry because we would then have to walk outside to get in to the establishment but then were happy because we noticed that the people inside ordering pizza were sketchy to say the least and we felt it would be unsafe if the door attaching to two establishments would have been open. We went back to our room and called front desk to see if we could get food delivered but no one answered the phone! I though front desk was suppose to be there at all times to assist us! We called back 4 times in 45 minutes and no one answered. How about if there was an emergency? Needless to say we went to bed hungry that night! -The next day we checked out to come back home and we were charged $3.50 for the bottle of water that we drank in our room that we figured was complimentary because it was just a regular bottle of water on the coffee table when we arrived. Usually items that are charged are in a mini bar or have notes on them saying that you must pay to consume! -During our stay we noticed many of the visitors were young guys here in Montreal to party, who probably don't care about a clean room and that just want shelter to sleep. So that is who I recommend this hotel for. If you don't care about dirt or an unfriendly, non-helpful staff and put location on the top of your priority list then reserve this hotel but I think most people could do better. Next time my friends and I will spend a bit more so we actually feel like we are on vacation and not in some hostel in an impoverished area!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BGSUFalcon13
Reviews.Content: Traveled by train from Windsor to Toronto to Montreal mainly to see a Montreal Canadians hockey game with my 18 year old son (our first time to Montreal). A 10 minute walk from the train station, the room we stayed in was on the 12th floor. The room had a two queen size beds, a small couch, and a small table with chairs. The room was larger than expected and clean and comfortable. The bathroom although small was clean and everything worked. Staff was very helpful. Any question we asked was answered. Hotel in in a great location to explore all of Downtown Montreal. The Belle Centre (hockey arena) and shopping (i.e. Eaton Centre) and many places to eat within walking distance. The street is in an area with bars so is crowded with people on weekend nights and during after hockey games, but we had no problems with noise or anything else. This is not the Ritz, but I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bug Alert!!!”
Reviews.Author: mtl28
Reviews.Content: A few friends and I went to the Quality Inn Hotel in the summer time. Overall, we weren't in the room much, basically just to get ready to go out, change and sleep. The only good thing is the location. The ONLY good thing. The front desk was incrediably rude, and at one point when our neighbours were being loud, he uninvitedly unlocked our door and barged inside! The bathrooms are not that great, the rooms are look very old and smell just as bad. Non smoking rooms, smell like smoke anyway. But by far.. the WORST thing ever was the bed bugs. At first there was one.. then two.. then a few days later THERE WERE MILLIONS!! This place has a HUGE problem. Bed bugs were the worst experience of my life. So itchy you could not imagine. I also had an alergic reaction to them, so things only got worse from there. And the thought of sleeping on filthy nasty bugs only makes me want to puke more. This hotel is DIRTY, only only because of the close down ghetto strip club you have a beautiful view of, but because of the HORRIBLE, ITCHY, NASTY BED BUGS! Luckily the most of them showed up after the trip, still had fun but only because it was Montreal and its not possible to not have fun there. BEEEWAAARE OF BED BUGS, I CANNOT STRESS THIS ENOUGH!!

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: GM1Pa
Reviews.Content: There is not enough parking, Arrived on a Saturday night and there wasn't any parking for the guests. Asked front desk were i can park they said Along the street you shouldn't get a ticket tonight. they advertise high speed in the rooms, I for got my cord ask if they have one they said probly not tonight, Asked if they have wirerless was told only in the lobby and there is no access coded needed, went to lobby tried to get on couldn't Asked desk, then was told you need an access code, ask if i could get it he said you have to wait. the roms are ok a little old could use updated.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Bed Bugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: gypsyjim79
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I stayed in 3 neighboring rooms at this property over Labor Day Weekend 2007. Although the hotel was located in a great location for our bachelor party needs, the discovery of bed bug bites about a week and a half after our visit caused great alarm. The price may be right, but suffering through the irritaiton and humiliation of bed bug bites does not make this hotel a place you want to stay. I have yet to contact the hotel to make them aware of the problem, however I plan to do so soon. This property is INFESTED!!!

Reviews.Title: “On paper it's great, shame about the noise”
Reviews.Author: tjones4
Reviews.Content: My room was big, a little tatty in places, but otherwise clean. I had a decent size bed, good bathroom, air con, and plenty of storage. But during my four night stay, 2 consecutive nights during the week were ruined because of the noise. My room was at the back of the hotel and faced out onto a row of bars. Even on the 14th floor - I could hear rock music playing until 3AM! The hotel is certainly central - but since I couldn't guarantee you'd get a decent night's sleep - I wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: AnAussieCanuck
Reviews.Content: Sept 17th 2006 (three nights) $119 CAD / night My boyfriend and I have decided to put this into good/not so good format.
